alternative_parents.description: Compounds comprising the organic carbonic acid or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Organic carbonic acids and derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic chemical compounds with one or more oxygen atoms combined with another element.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging to either the halogen hydrides, halogen nitrides, halogen oxides, or halogen sulfides.
class.name: Halogen organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as halogen oxides. These are inorganic compounds containing an oxygen atom of an oxidation state of -2, in which the heaviest atom bonded to the oxygen is a halogen.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds containing an oxygen atom of an oxidation state of -2, in which the heaviest atom bonded to the oxygen is a halogen.
direct_parent.name: Halogen oxides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds containing an oxygen atom of an oxidation state of -2, in which the heaviest atom bonded to the oxygen is a halogen.
subclass.name: Halogen oxides

superclass.description: Inorganic compounds that contain only metal elements.
superclass.name: Homogeneous non-metal compounds
